hints.content: Start by understanding the input format. You are given an array of integers representing the strength of different bacterial strains and an integer indicating the time required to eliminate each strain.
Consider how you would approach eliminating the strains. What happens if you eliminate one strain? How does that affect the remaining strains?
Think about the relationship between the strengths of the strains and the time taken to eliminate them. Does eliminating a stronger strain first make sense?
You might want to sort the array of strengths. How would sorting help you decide which strain to eliminate first?
When sorting, consider whether you should sort in ascending or descending order. What would be the implications of each choice?
After sorting, think about how you would iterate through the list of strengths. What condition would you check for each strain?
Remember that you need to keep track of the total time taken. How will you accumulate this time as you eliminate each strain?
Consider edge cases where the array might be empty or contain only one strain. How should your function handle these scenarios?
What should happen if the time required to eliminate a strain is greater than its strength? How does this affect your approach?
Think about how you will return the total time. Should it be a single integer or an array? What does the problem specify?
As you iterate through the sorted strengths, how will you determine when to stop eliminating strains? Is there a specific condition to check?
Consider how to handle ties in strength. If two strains have the same strength, does it matter which one you eliminate first?
Make sure to test your function with various inputs, including edge cases, to ensure it handles all scenarios correctly.
As you finalize your approach, think about the time complexity of your solution. Is it efficient enough given the constraints?
You are very close! Try to outline the final steps of your algorithm. What will be the main loop or recursive call structure?

questionNotes: Input is an array of integers representing bacterial strengths.
An integer represents the time required to eliminate each strain.
Consider edge cases like empty arrays or single-element arrays.
The return format should be a single integer representing total time.
